name: Baked Polenta with Fresh Tomatoes and Parmesan
author: rjohl
summary: This recipe is a perfect way to highlight and use fresh summer tomatoes.  It makes a great side dish for grilled chicken or pork chops.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon butter, chilled and cut into pieces
directions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Place the water, milk, and butter in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat
Add the polenta and stir with a wooden spoon until thickened, about 5 minutes
Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup Parmesan cheese and 2 chopped basil leaves; season with salt and pepper to taste
Transfer the polenta to the prepared baking dish and arrange the remaining chilled pieces of butter over the top
Bake the polenta in the preheated oven until bubbly and beginning to brown, 15 to 20 minutes
Decoratively arrange the slices of tomato over the top of the polenta, spread the remaining basil leaves over the tomatoes, and sprinkle with 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese
Return to the oven and bake until the tomatoes are warm and the Parmesan cheese is bubbly, 5 to 10 minutes
